definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
to spread out/to open up/to exhibit/to put into effect/to postpone/to prolong/exhibition

pinyin: Fa3 lan2 ke4 fu2 Che1 zhan3

sentences.english: The Porsche stand at the IAA Motor Show , held in Berlin in September 1951.
sentences.chinese: 1951年9月德國法蘭克福車展上的保時捷展位。

sentences.english: This were invited to attend the second lanzhou international auto show.
sentences.chinese: 本次應邀參加第二屆蘭州國際車展。

sentences.english: Better half: A cross-sectioned new Buick on display at the Shanghai auto show on April 20.
sentences.chinese: 4月20日上海車展，新款別克車的橫截面。

sentences.english: Att the Car Exhibition, several of the latest models were on display.
sentences.chinese: 在車展上，有最新的幾個款式展出。

sentences.english: What information will Dongfeng Nissan transfer to the industry by the show?
sentences.chinese: 通過本屆車展，東風日產要向業界傳遞何種信息？

sentences.english: This luxury car were unveiled at the Geneva Motor Show in 2010.
sentences.chinese: 這輛豪華車亮相於2010年日內瓦車展。

sentences.english: This year's auto exhibition received unanimous acclaim.
sentences.chinese: 本屆車展受到參觀者交口稱讚。

sentences.english: A model poses with a Chevrolet at an auto show in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 雪佛萊的車模在北京汽車展上擺出造型。

sentences.english: But this year the parties were in full swing again.
sentences.chinese: 但是今年的車展又現如火如荼的場景。

sentences.english: Titan tractor tire spotter at the SEMA 2008 auto show.
sentences.chinese: 2008年某車展上的巨型拖拉機輪胎。

sentences.english: His great-uncle had a car on display too.
sentences.chinese: 他叔祖父也參與了車展。

sentences.english: The 2010 Beijing International Auto Exhibition opens Friday, according to NetEase Auto.
sentences.chinese: 據網易汽車報道，2010北京國際車展今日開展。

sentences.english: Rolls-Royce has unveiled an electric Phantom at the Geneva motor show.
sentences.chinese: 勞斯萊斯於日內瓦車展上公開了其幻影車型的電動版。

sentences.english: Many clean cars exhibited at the show will be put into mass production because subsidies for purchases of alternative-energy vehicles are expected to be available this year.
sentences.chinese: 據悉，在車展中發佈的新能源車型有望年內投入量產。

sentences.english: We were handed a program when we entered the car show.
sentences.chinese: 進入車展的時候我們得了一張節目單。

sentences.english: The Geely GT grabs attention at the Shanghai auto show last month.
sentences.chinese: 吉利GT在上月的上海車展上很是引人注目。

definition: to beat the gong to open a performance
the curtain falls/lower the curtain/to come to an end (of a meeting)
carnival during the Lantern Festival, with lantern displays and traditional folk performances such as stilt walking and lion dance
opera (or role) involving much singing and action/(fig.) highlight/main feature/major activity
the number of showings of a movie, play etc/screening/performance
conferences and exhibitions, abbr. of 會議展覽|会议展览[hui4 yi4 zhan3 lan3]
to exhibit at or take part in a trade show etc
